p: In light of this observation, the differences in the accumulation of major biologically active compounds in O. ehrenbergii EO associated with the seasonal development of the plant confirm the influence of the physiological stages on EO composition. The observed chemical variability could be due to the interactions between genetic (biotic) factors, climatic and environmental (abiotic) factors, seasonality, age, maturity, and ontogenic stages of the plant [ 35]. The accumulation of particular terpenes during specific plant developmental stages could also be explained by their ecological roles of defense, securing the plant from predators or abiotic stress [ 36]. Thus, monitoring plant physiological stages is fundamental for the choice of the best time of harvest.
